de._2d6.dfa

Class DeterministicFiniteAutomaton

  • java.lang.Object
    • de._2d6.dfa.DeterministicFiniteAutomaton
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryMultiplesOfThree, EvenNumberOfZeroes

    public class DeterministicFiniteAutomaton
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    2d6 Implements a deterministic finite automaton. For further information, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deterministic_finite_automaton

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeterministicFiniteAutomaton()
      Creates a Deterministic Finite Automaton instance

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentStateIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getCurrentStateIdentifier()
        Returns:
        The identifier of the current state of the automaton

      • getStartingStateIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getStartingStateIdentifier()
        Returns:
        The identifier of the starting state of the automaton

      • isCurrentStateAccepting

        public boolean isCurrentStateAccepting()
        Returns:
        True if the current state is an accepting state

      • addState

        public void addState(java.lang.String identifier,
                     boolean isAccepting)
        Adds a state to the automaton. If the automaton already possesses a state with identical identifier, the existing state is overwritten. If this is the first state to be added to the automaton, it is set as the starting state.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the state to be added
        isAccepting - True if the identifier to be added is accepting

      • evaluateInput

        public void evaluateInput(java.lang.String input)
        Evaluates a certain input to the automaton according to its innate logic.
        Parameters:
        input - A String to be evaluated by the automaton

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(java.lang.String inputStateIdentifier,
                          char symbol,
                          java.lang.String outputStateIdentifier)
        Adds a transition rule to the transition function of the automaton.
        Parameters:
        inputStateIdentifier - The identifier of the state prior to the transition
        symbol - The symbol effecting the transition
        outputStateIdentifier - The identifier of the state subsequent to the transition
